titleStmt.title: James Taylor et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9789

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky
Your petitioners Citizens and long residents of Campbell & Kenton Counties would respectfully represent to your Excellency

That Joseph Temple for nearly a quarter of a century a resident of said Counties has been found by the verdict of a jury in Kenton County guilty of perjury & Sentenced to two years confinement in the penitentiary

Your petitioners state that Joseph Temple is an Old man now in the evening of his life that for more than twenty years he has resided in this community & has born the reputation of an useful industrious & respected Citizen, that while your petitioners do not impign the integrity or the intelligence of the jury yet that they can but believe that the sentance was hasty & unjust. At all events the previous unimpeached correctness of the character of this unfortunate man pleads strongly & eloquently for leniency at the hands of the Executive & we his neighbors & fellow Citizens in whose midst the better remnant of his life is to be passed earnestly urge & request your excellency to pardon him

James Taylor
Robert Todd
John H Barlow
James E Perry
R. H. Caldwell
James. R. Morin
Samuel Morlidge
B F Caldwell
Saml Winston

p.note:
I have Known Mr Temple for many years he once resided on my fathers Land I have had dealings with him for Large amounts on my books & papers show I have always found him correct & honest & besided a very liberal man
James Taylor
